requirement: The system will authenticate user via login and password and check which hospital department or ward the user belongs to.
The receiving setting request should include information that is critical to determining whether the receiving setting is able to accept the patient.
System will authenticate user via login and password and check which hospital  department or ward user belongs to
The user should not have to wait a long time for a transaction.
Access additional patient data via health information exchange in the EHR.
Incomplete information should prevent efficient health information exchange activities or utilization of electronic health information.
The patient identity may be agreed upon by a number of means including demographic information agreed-to mapping of patient IDs or shared patient ID.
It may be possible that the consultation request may need to be processed as a referral and the consulting clinician may continue to provide care for or manage the patient.
The system shall return supreme results.
The database can be encrypted and the SSL shall be used to encrypt the communication between the client and the server.
The system shall let a user who is an administrator or a project manager with the correct permissions and logged into the system to exit the review of time without either approving or rejecting it.
System will allow for storing encounter images or photos
The location pointers shall be used by the clinician to retrieve the lab test results for either viewing or integration into the EHR.
The system should allow multiple users to login concurrently.
The user shall experenice supreme speed.
The battery low warning lamp shall light up when the voltage drops below 3.6 Volts, and the current workspace or input data shall be saved.
The messages should be encrypted for login communications so others cannot get username and password from those messages.
Needs to use minimal system requirements.
A user should have a distinct theme when they log in.
A user should be able to input a maximum and a minimum price range  a maximum and a minimum distance according to his/her position  a restaurant type  or a specific dish.
If a user wants to create an account and the desired username is occupied the user should be asked to choose a different username.
The system can allow IT support to roll NHC data back to the previous version.
There shall be user interface that is remarkable and provides users a delightful experience on the website.
The system must be able to show an overview and forecast of the bed occupation.
Forms will provide support for checking input format.
The system must be designed so users can learn the system on their own.

The care coordinator or clinician at the receiving setting receives a request to accept a patient. This request includes information that is critical to determining whether the receiving setting is able to accept the patient.

The patient may create and/or update their list of providers and determine the access permissions that should be granted to those providers for their personally controlled health information as described in the Consumer Empowerment: 2007 Consumer Access to Clinical Information Detailed Use Case.
A configuration message includes for each service a list with 0, 1, or more objects that are involved with the execution of the service.
A user should be able to search the application as much as possible.
Additional patient data must be found via health information exchange in the EHR.
A client shall have to intervene with a customer as little as possible.
The system will allow for storing encounter images or photos.
The system must use NHC data that is reasonably recent.
The system must provide for the possibility for third-party expansion of the system.
When viewing the results in a list  a user should be able to sort the results according to price  distance  restaurant type  specific dish or restaurant name.
The system shall detect when an operator-adaptable number of unsuccessful authentication attempts occur related to either log-in to any system account or initiate of a remote connection.
During this phase, the system will scan the crossing area in order to establish whether any obstacles are present.
The system must protect unintended user actions from causing the system to close down  neither on the client nor on the server.
